name: Jumping Jacks
description: A classic full-body cardio exercise. Jump while spreading legs shoulder-width apart and raising arms overhead, then return to starting position.
instructions: Stand upright with legs together and arms at your sides
Jump while spreading legs shoulder-width apart

name: High Knees
description: Run in place while lifting knees as high as possible toward your chest. Great for building cardiovascular endurance.
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Run in place, lifting knees toward chest
Aim to bring knees to hip level or higher
Pump arms naturally as you run

name: Burpees
description: A full-body explosive movement combining a squat, plank, push-up, and jump. Excellent for building strength and cardio endurance.
instructions: Drop into squat and place hands on floor
Jump feet back into plank position
Jump feet back to squat position
Explode up into a jump with arms overhead

name: Mountain Climbers
description: Start in plank position and alternate bringing knees toward chest in a running motion. Great core and cardio exercise.
instructions: Start in plank position with hands under shoulders
Quickly switch legs, bringing left knee toward chest
Continue alternating in a running motion
Keep hips level and core engaged

name: Sprint Intervals
description: High-intensity running intervals. Run at maximum effort for short bursts followed by recovery periods.
instructions: Warm up with light jogging for 5 minutes
Cool down with walking between intervals

name: Jump Rope
description: Classic cardio exercise using a jump rope. Great for coordination, footwork, and cardiovascular fitness.
instructions: Hold rope handles at hip level
Rotate rope with wrists, not arms

name: Box Jumps
description: Jump onto a sturdy box or platform, then step back down. Builds explosive power and cardiovascular fitness.
instructions: Stand facing a sturdy box or platform
Squat slightly and swing arms back

name: Treadmill Running
description: Steady-state or interval running on a treadmill. Adjust speed and incline for varying intensity.
instructions: Gradually increase to comfortable running pace

name: Rowing Machine
description: Full-body cardio exercise using a rowing machine. Great for building endurance and strength simultaneously.
instructions: Sit on rowing machine with feet secured
Start with legs, then lean back, then pull arms
Reverse the motion: arms, lean forward, legs

name: Stationary Bike
description: Cycling exercise on a stationary bike. Low-impact cardio that's easy on joints.
instructions: Adjust seat height to proper position

name: Battle Ropes
description: High-intensity exercise using heavy ropes. Create waves with alternating or simultaneous arm movements.
instructions: Hold one rope end in each hand
Create waves by moving arms up and down

name: Kettlebell Swings
description: Dynamic exercise swinging a kettlebell from between legs to chest height. Great for posterior chain and cardio.
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulders
Hinge at hips and swing kettlebell between legs
Drive hips forward to swing kettlebell to chest height
Let gravity bring kettlebell back down

name: Step-Ups
description: Step up onto a platform or bench, then step back down. Great for building leg strength and cardio endurance.
instructions: Stand facing a sturdy bench or platform
Step up with right foot, bringing left foot up
Step back down with the same foot
Keep chest up and core engaged

name: Bear Crawls
description: Crawl forward on hands and feet with knees hovering just above ground. Excellent full-body cardio exercise.
instructions: Crawl forward moving opposite hand and foot
Keep core tight and hips level

name: Elliptical Machine
description: Low-impact cardio exercise on an elliptical trainer. Great for those with joint issues.
instructions: Step onto elliptical with feet on pedals
Grab handles and start slow movement
Keep back straight and core engaged
Use both arms and legs for full-body workout

name: Plank Jacks
description: Combine plank hold with jumping jack leg movement. Great for core strength and cardio conditioning.
instructions: Jump feet wide apart while maintaining plank
Keep core engaged and hips stable

name: Squat Jumps
description: Explosive jumping movement from squat position. Builds lower body power and cardiovascular fitness.
instructions: Land softly back in squat position
Keep chest up and core engaged
Use arms for momentum and balance

name: Stair Climbing
description: Running or walking up stairs for cardiovascular conditioning. Use actual stairs or stair climbing machine.
instructions: Run or walk up at steady pace
Use handrail for balance if needed
Take two steps at a time for intensity

name: Dancing
description: Fun cardio workout through dance movements. Follow along with dance videos or freestyle.

name: Wall Balls
description: Throw a medicine ball against a wall from squat position. Combines strength training with cardio conditioning.
instructions: Hold medicine ball at chest level
Squat down keeping ball close to chest
Explode up and throw ball to wall target
Catch ball on the way down

name: Swimming
description: Full-body, low-impact cardio exercise in water. Excellent for cardiovascular fitness and muscle endurance.
instructions: Start with warm-up laps at easy pace

name: HIIT Circuit
description: High-Intensity Interval Training combining multiple exercises. Alternate between high-intensity work and rest periods.
instructions: Work at maximum effort for work period

name: Thrusters
description: Combine front squat with overhead press using dumbbells or barbell. Full-body explosive movement.
instructions: Press weights overhead as you stand

name: Lateral Shuffles
description: Side-to-side shuffling movement staying low in athletic position. Great for agility and cardio.
instructions: Shuffle to the right staying low
Keep feet wide and chest up

name: Bike Sprints
description: High-intensity cycling intervals on stationary bike. Alternate between all-out sprints and recovery.
instructions: Warm up with 5 minutes easy cycling

name: Outdoor Running
description: Running outdoors on various terrains. Great for cardiovascular fitness and mental health benefits of fresh air.
instructions: Maintain good posture with relaxed shoulders

name: Treadmill Walking Incline
description: Walking on treadmill with incline for low-impact cardio that's easier on joints than running.
instructions: Walk at brisk but comfortable pace
Keep shoulders back and core engaged
Gradually increase incline as fitness improves

name: Treadmill Intervals
description: Alternating between high-intensity running and recovery periods on treadmill.
instructions: Run at high intensity for work interval
Recover with walking or light jogging

name: Pool Running
description: Running in deep water while wearing a flotation belt. Excellent low-impact cardio for injury recovery.
instructions: Wear a flotation belt in deep water
Maintain running motion without touching bottom
Keep upright posture and pump arms
Lean slightly forward and drive knees up

name: Freestyle Swimming
description: Front crawl swimming stroke focusing on technique and endurance. Most popular and efficient swimming stroke.
instructions: Start with streamlined push off from wall
Breathe every 2-3 strokes to one side

name: Swimming Laps Mixed Strokes
description: Swimming different strokes (freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke) for varied muscle engagement.
instructions: Rest briefly at wall between stroke changes
Focus on proper technique over speed

name: Water Aerobics
description: Low-impact aerobic exercises performed in shallow water. Great for all fitness levels and joint-friendly.
instructions: Perform marching, jumping jacks, or leg lifts
Use water resistance for arm movements
Follow along with instructor or routine

name: Cross Trainer
description: Full-body cardio workout on cross trainer/elliptical with adjustable resistance and incline.
instructions: Step onto machine and grab moving handles
Keep back straight and core engaged

name: StairMaster
description: Climbing machine that simulates stair climbing for intense lower body and cardio workout.
instructions: Step onto machine and set comfortable pace
Keep full foot contact on each step
Stand upright, avoid leaning on handrails
Take full steps, don't just tap toes

name: Spin Bike
description: High-intensity indoor cycling on specialized stationary bike with adjustable resistance.
instructions: Adjust seat height and handlebar position
Vary between seated and standing positions
Follow instructor cues or personal interval plan

name: Recumbent Bike
description: Low-impact cycling exercise on recumbent bike with back support. Great for those with back issues.
instructions: Adjust seat so knees are slightly bent at full extension

name: Arc Trainer
description: Low-impact cardio machine combining elements of elliptical and stair climber for total body workout.
instructions: Step onto foot plates and grab handles
Coordinate upper and lower body smoothly

name: Jogging in Place
description: Simple cardio exercise that can be done anywhere. Great for warming up or quick cardio bursts.
instructions: Begin jogging motion staying in place
Land softly on balls of feet

name: Shadowboxing
description: Boxing movements performed without equipment. Great cardio workout that improves coordination.
instructions: Stand in boxing stance with guard up
Keep moving and bouncing on feet
Add defensive movements like slips and ducks

name: Track Running
description: Running on a track for precise distance and pace control. Ideal for speed work and interval training.
instructions: Run in lane 1 for accurate distance
Maintain steady pace for distance runs
Use inner lanes for speed work
Cool down with walking or light jogging

name: Hill Running
description: Running uphill for increased intensity and strength building. Excellent for building power and endurance.
instructions: Run up at steady, controlled effort
Walk or jog down for recovery

name: Fartlek Training
description: Swedish speed play combining continuous running with interval training. Mix fast and slow segments.
instructions: Add random speed bursts during run
Sprint to landmarks or for set times
Recover with easy jogging between efforts
Keep total session playful and unstructured
